body_html: @ngimel they do not necessarily need trainable shifts and scales, but in that case yes size needs to be known in advance. I believe that most of the time people will use trainable shifts and scales, so it may be a lower priority in that sense.

body: @ngimel they do not necessarily need trainable shifts and scales, but in that case yes size needs to be known in advance. I believe that most of the time people will use trainable shifts and scales, so it may be a lower priority in that sense.
